data.text: Long Pants for Bike Touring in Cold Weather
Hi, I'm looking for a recommendation for long pants that will be suitable for bike touring. What pants do you ride with when it's cool?
Thermal tights! over or under shorts. If colder than that add cover pants.
data.author: Whit Elfner

data.text:
I have a pair of these for colder cycling: https://keelaoutdoors.com/product/roadrunner-trousers/
Roadrunner Cycle Trousers with reflective trim and four way stretch
keelaoutdoors.com
data.author: John Rawlins

data.text: How ‚Äùcool‚Äù are we talking here? üòÅ
data.author: Garron Allman

data.text: Good question
data.author: David Allan

data.text: I ride in shorts and just use leg warmers underneath when it gets cold. Leg warmers won't catch on the chain, unlike pants, as they are close fitting to the skin
data.author: Josh Brearley

data.text: Oh and if it gets really cold, I'll put on my rain pants
data.author: Josh Brearley

data.text: I use a pair of Patagonia pants for cool days and Bontrager makes a winter riding pant (below freezing) neither of these have ever been any issue with the chain on any of my bikes (Trek 1120, Trek Top Fuel 9.8 or Trek Counterpoint). Leg warmer are used in milder conditions.
data.author: Bill Dove

data.text: I wear any tactical pant has pockets on the sides
data.author: ÿ∫ŸàŸäŸÑÿ® ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿ±ÿ∂ÿß

data.text: I always have a pair of leggings that I carry and wear under my pants if it is cold.
data.author: Gerald Raton

data.text: Tbh cheap Craghoppers, and add some no name Merino/thin leggings when it's cold.
data.author: Nick Paton

data.text: xc-ski leggings with a linerüëå

data.text:
I wear these for winter riding. https://a.co/d/4SRHCY1
ROCKBROS Winter Cycling Pants Warm Ergonomics Men's Windproof Thermal Bicycling Pants Black

data.author: Josh Bennett

data.text: I like bib longs.
data.author: Pete Nightingale

data.text: I use cross country ski socks Works great I push tops down to ankles when it warms up or when climbing Reverse when cold
data.author: Charles Nighbor

data.text: However I look like a drok
data.author: Charles Nighbor

data.text: Columbia Silver Ridge with zip off legs
data.author: Richard Gould

data.text: Kuhl radikal. Or any Kuhl pant.
data.author: Tom Cavan

data.text: Bamboo yoga pants
data.author: Will Taylor

data.text: Mine a from Prana, with elastic waist. Very comfortable.
data.author: Will Taylor

data.text: Pearl Izumi Launch pants.
data.author: Terri White

data.text: I use running tights in winter when casual or local riding and Pearl Izumi pants with pockets when touring. The latter are great for cycling and when off bike and visiting a museum, ‚Ä¶and I prefer to look less like I came from a gym, want a couple pockets, etc.
data.author: Jim Lee

data.text: Socks no cotton Wool or polyester
data.author: Charles Nighbor

data.text: REI has long pants that cling to your leg. Not that appealing except when your cycling and don't want to get the cuff interfering with your pedaling.
data.author: Tom Heinze

data.text: Fall and winter I always wear Castelli leggings with chamois and when it's really cold I put a pair of track pants over them with a leg band of course. Toasty toasty all winter.
data.author: Cindy Delaney

data.text: I ride in the hiking pants that stretch.. Some also have skinny legs which don't get caught in the chain. There are different weights of fabric. OK for summer or autumn. For winter I would wear a skiing or hiking base layer, maybe merino long underpants.. Most of this sort of stuff is quickdry too.
data.author: Mark Perry

data.text: Tights
data.author: Garth Riess

data.text: I use a fleece lined pair of cycling tights with a chamois. And if it rains I have a pair of showers pass rain pants.
data.author: Deirdre Roberts

data.text: Outdoor Research Ferrosi pants.
data.author: Paul Lefebvre

data.text: Shorts with a pair of athletic pants underneath until it hits -5¬∞C. Then I wear my Columbia waterproof/wind resistant pants with a pair of athletic pants underneath, no issues in -30¬∞C Canadian winters.
data.author: Jason McMahon

data.text: Under armour tights over cycling shorts
data.author: Cronan Grennan

data.text: Ground Effect have the best long pants. Wearing them now.
data.author: Kerry Palmer

data.author: Eyal Hershtik

data.text: I hate cycling specific pants, so I bought rock climbing pants from patagonia. It has a flexible material, designed for big extravagant leg movements. But I do not ride an upright bike, so my case is different.
data.author: D√°niel Attila V√°nyi

data.text: Merino wool base layer tights and then a pair of hiking pants over.
data.author: Bhaskar Bhave

data.text: Jeans with long underwear if necessary. A trouser band to keep right leg out if the chain. Saddle rubs on buttocks' not the crotch.
data.author: Todd Ostler

data.text: Love my Giro pants, stretchy and super comfy, enough for when is chill and if it gets cold I use warm underwear.
data.author: Omare War
